title: DHCPSubnetCLients
extract: A DHCP scope is a valid range of IP addresses that are available for assignment or lease to client computers on a particular subnet. ... Scopes determine which IP addresses are provided to the clients. They should be defined and activated before DHCP clients use the DHCP server for its dynamic IP configuration.
extract_html: A DHCP scope is a valid range of IP addresses that are available for assignment or lease to client computers on a particular subnet. ... Scopes determine which IP addresses are provided to the clients. They should be defined and activated before DHCP clients use the DHCP server for its dynamic IP configuration.
